alert.note: Alert for Latimer; Le Flore; Pushmataha (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 24 at 9:01AM CDT until March 24 at 10:45AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR SOUTHEASTERN LATIMER, WEST CENTRAL LE FLORE AND NORTHWESTERN PUSHMATAHA COUNTIES... At 901 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated mostly light to moderate rain in the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of up to a half inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is likely ongoing in some areas. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Clayton... Talihina... Red Oak... Albion... Yanush... Tuskahoma... Clayton Lake State Park... Kiamichi... Stanley... Dunbar... Bengal... Talimena State Park... Kosoma... Sardis... Eubanks... FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5-1.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
